nodes.bodyText: Path is relative, absolute or either ?
I think it would be better to merge comments on model with #10733. Please write comments in #10733 if they're not already resolved there.
Can you elaborate what this is ? Also do bother of these get set or only one of them ?
Ditto.
Please add documentation for this (including properties).
Ditto.
Please add a TODO to remove this experiment when full solution is fully implemented (for all supported runners).
done.
done.
Is this method just to get artifacts from the experiment ? If so please name this method accordingly.

It gets a list of all artifacts from the experiment as well as from ClassLoader. The method was moved from PortableRunner to pre-generate the dependencies (originally the dependencies were calculated when submitting pipeline).

It gets a list of all artifacts from the experiment as well as from ClassLoader. The method was moved from PortableRunner to pre-generate the dependencies (originally the dependencies were calculated when submitting pipeline).
"Unsupported artifact type ..." might be a better error here.
done.
Is this the behavior expected by Beam runners (zipping up directories) ?
Looks like this was the previous behavior.

Probably it's better to explicitly declare the given environment as the default (through an additional argument to registerEnvironment()) instead of assuming first one that was passed to here to be the default.
Created a separate ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9425

Why should this be a separate ticket ? Can't we just change method to registerEnvironment(Environment env, boolean default)
and change above to
sdkComponents.registerEnvironment(
Environments.createOrGetDefaultEnvironment(portablePipelineOptions), true);
If we change the signature of registerEnvironment, a number of test files (*TranslationTest, *RunnerTest) also need to be touched. I think it will create unnecessary noise in this PR.
Ok. Let's still do this immediately after this one though so that we do not forget about it.
This is a case where doing it in a different commit in the same PR could make sense. But I'm OK with deferring as long as it happens soon.
Would this be better placed in createOrGetDefaultEnvironment?
agreed. moved to createOrGetDefaultEnvironment.
Perhaps it's worth pulling this out into a separate method?
done.
Does this actually stage them, or just add them to the returned list? If not, the name and docstring should be updated.

@@ -331,22 +389,23 @@ def _download_file(from_url, to_path):
   def _is_remote_path(path):
     return path.find('://') != -1
 
-  def _stage_jar_packages(self, jar_packages, staging_location, temp_dir):
-    # type: (...) -> List[str]
+  @staticmethod
+  def _stage_jar_packages(jar_packages, temp_dir):
